The Emergency Response Program is written, includes specific actions to be taken in response to an accidental release, includes procedures for informing the public and local agencies responsible for responding to an accidental release, and includes information on emergency health care.

7. Planned changes to improve safety

The BEN E KEITH - GULF COAST, TEXAS FACILITY is incorporating and addressing any recommendations resulting from the Process Hazard Analysis, Offsite Consequences, and program audits. The flexibility of the program allows the BEN E KEITH - GULF COAST, TEXAS FACILITY to respond effectively to prevent or minimize any potential exposure of BEN E KEITH - GULF COAST, TEXAS FACILITY employees, the surrounding public, and/or the environment to a release of anhydrous ammonia. Specific actions taken to improve safety are the implementation of the Program 3 Prevention Program described above, improved operator training, administrative controls, and computerized system controls. Updates since the last RM-Plan submission: Moved the PSM/RM program to an online program that allows access to the PSM/RM programs 24/7/365 from any internet connected device, added an additional ammonia technician to better maintain the system, sent operators to refrigeration school (GCAP), installed three new condensers, and updated PPE equipment. Upcoming improvements include: new refrigeration compressor, updating the condenser water treatment system, and upgrading operating panels on compressors.

system), so the training and preventative programs are updated as the system expands and changes.

5. The five-year accident history

A five-year accident history has prepared and included in this Risk Management Plan (RMPlan). The accidents that have occurred in the past 5-years were identified during the 2022 Process Hazard Analysis study. The three accidents reported and recorded on the 2022 PHA were not reportable accidents, but were investigated as near misses, as they did not cause ammonia releases that exceeded the reportable quantity of 100 lbs. over a 24-hour period. To prevent and/or minimize any potential future release of anhydrous ammonia, the BEN E KEITH - GULF COAST, TEXAS FACILITY has implemented a detailed Process Safety Management program (Preventive Program 3).
Near miss 1: 5/15/2021. O-ring failure on compressor's relief valve. The relief valve was replaced and the remainder of the similar-style relief valves were leak checked.
Near miss 2: 6/05/2021. Excessive ice causes an evaporator fan blade to break. The route cause was identified as failed door seals on the penthouse door allowing excessive moisture to enter the penthouse and freeze on the coil and blades. The facility has since began to check penthouse evaporators daily and is sourcing new door seals.
Near miss 3: 2/14/2023. A forklift traveling in an unauthorized forklift area struck an evaporator - resulted in damaged equipment, but no ammonia release. Site is installing a physical barrier to prevent forklifts from entering the area and is evaluating the remainder of the evaporators for proper guarding.

6. The emergency response program

Emergency response is discussed in the Risk Management Program (RMP) binder of the complete program.  The BEN E KEITH - GULF COAST, TEXAS FACILITY has a detailed Emergency Response Plan for their facility. The purpose of this plan is to provide the means for rapidly determining the appropriate response for any emergency that may develop at the faci

needed to the evaporators where heat is absorbed and removed from the medium. The anhydrous ammonia refrigeration system is a closed loop two stage industrial refrigeration system. The ammonia is not used or mixed in any manner with other chemical processes.

3. The Worst-case release scenario(s) and the alternative release scenario(s), including administrative controls and mitigation measures to limit the distances for each reported scenario

A Worst-Case Scenario Offsite Consequence Analysis and an Alternative Scenario Offsite Consequence Analysis were performed identifying the public and environmental receptors within the toxic endpoint concentration radius of 200 ppm. The results are mitigated by the fact that all the vessels and the much of the piping are inside the BEN E KEITH - GULF COAST, TEXAS FACILITY building. A variety of administrative controls and computerized controls are in place to shut the system down when operating parameters and limits are exceeded.

4. The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific preventative steps

The basic elements of the Program 3 Prevention program have been developed and are now in place. These include:

Process Safety Information
Process Hazard Analysis
Standard Operating Procedures
Safe Work Practices
Employee and Operator Training Programs
Mechanical Integrity Program
Management of Change Procedures
PSM Compliance Audit Procedures
Incident Investigation Procedures
Employee Participation Program
Hot Work Permit Procedures
Contractor Safety Program
Emergency Response Program

Ammonia specific prevention steps include:

Administrative controls
Operator Training
Computerized controls

The Preventive Program 3 provides extensive maintenance and operator/mechanic training to ensure that the system's mechanical integrity is maintained for the life of the covered process. Program 3 also incorporates administrative controls when modifications are made to the covered process (ammonia refrigeration

This Executive Summary briefly describes the following elements:

The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the stationary source.
The stationary source and regulated substances handled.
The worst-case release scenario(s) and the alternative release scenario(s), including administrative controls and mitigation measures to limit the distances for each reported scenario.
The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps.
The five-year accident history.
The emergency response program.
Planned changes to improve safety.

1. The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the stationary source

To address concerns of an accidental release, prevention and emergency response, all plant and field personnel are trained in ammonia emergency response procedures and use of appropriate protective equipment. Refresher training and emergency response drills are conducted on a periodic basis to ensure personnel are equipped, trained, prepared, and practiced in responding to ammonia emergencies. 

As a result of information gathered during preparation of this Risk Management Program, the BEN E KEITH - GULF COAST, TEXAS FACILITY is committing additional resources to further increase employee awareness and equipment reliability and to establish operator training and preventive maintenance programs. As a demonstration of the BEN E KEITH - GULF COAST, TEXAS FACILITY 's high degree of commitment to public safety and service, the BEN E KEITH - GULF COAST, TEXAS FACILITY is taking action to decrease the risk of ammonia exposure to the public by implementing recommendations made during the Process Hazards Analysis, Off-site Consequence Analysis, Compliance Audits, and 5-Year Mechanical Integrity Inspections.

2. The stationary source and regulated substances handled
